title: How to add 2 Ubuntu's to a multiboot DVD

forumNotes.author: agnieszkar1200
forumNotes.content:
Hi, I'm working on my multiboot DVD project. I would like to add Ubuntu 10.04 and BitDefender. I managed to add Bitdefender:  

title bitdefender  
kernel /casper/vmlinuz file=/cdrom/preseed/ubuntu.seed boot=casper initrd=/casper/initrd.gz splash vga=791 lang=de  
initrd /casper/initrd.gz  

But now I don't know how to add modify Ubuntu files, because both ubuntu and Bitdefender use the same files to boot.   
Can someone help me? Thanks for help.

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> Hi, I'm working on my multiboot DVD project. I would like to add Ubuntu 10.04 and BitDefender. I managed to add Bitdefender:  
>
> title bitdefender  
> kernel /casper/vmlinuz file=/cdrom/preseed/ubuntu.seed boot=casper initrd=/casper/initrd.gz splash vga=791 lang=de  
> initrd /casper/initrd.gz  
>
> But now I don't know how to add modify Ubuntu files, because both ubuntu and Bitdefender use the same files to boot.   
> Can someone help me? Thanks for help.  

See if you can use one of the two (or both) as .iso images.  
Here:  
<http://reboot.pro/forum/66/>  
<http://reboot.pro/5041/>  
(but also search the forum)  
This should do:  
> title BitDefender Rescue CD (Virus Scanner)  
> find --set-root /bitdefender-rescue-cd.iso  
> map /bitdefender-rescue-cd.iso (0xff)  
> map --hook  
> root (0xff)  
> kernel /casper/vmlinuz boot=casper iso-scan/filename=/bitdefender-rescue-cd.iso  
> initrd /casper/initrd.gz

Remember that on CDFS grub4dos is CaSe SeNsItIvE.  

:smile:  
Wonko

Unfortunately it doesn't work with Bitdefender. I have a question. Did I do something wrong or won't I have the possibility to choose between different languages. Currently it boots at once and there is an error:  

Cannot mount /dev/sda1 on /isodevice

forumNotes.author: agnieszkar1200
forumNotes.content:
This one helps:  

find --set-root /bitdefender.iso  
map /bitdefender.iso (0xff) \|\| map --mem /bitdefender.iso (0xff)  
map --hook  
root (0xff)  
chainloader (0xff)  

Thanks a lot for help.

forumNotes.content:
> Hi  
> Have you listed the contents of the bootloader file, please? If so, which one - Grub?  

The syntax ooriginally posted by **agnieszkar1200** can be used in BOTH GRUB (legacy) and grub4dos menu.lst.  

.iso mapping is possible in grub***4dos*** and NOT in GRUB (legacy):  
<http://reboot.pro/forum/66/>  

A similar iso mapping feature is present in BURG and GRUB2:  
<http://reboot.pro/13385/>  

<http://reboot.pro/12395/>  

:smile:  
Wonko

forumNotes.content: Don't know abour BitDefender Rescue CD, but u can decompress Ubuntu 10.10 ISO to a folder on the USB (eg. Ununtu-10.10) \& then try out this one ``` title Ubuntu 10.10 kernel /Ubuntu 10.10/casper/vmlinuz-org file=/Ubuntu 10.10/preseed/custom.seed boot=casper ignore_uuid live-media-path=Ubuntu 10.10/casper quiet splash vga=791 initrd /Ubuntu 10.10/casper/initrd.lz ```
